alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne; Rawlins (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 11:14PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Cheyenne and northern Rawlins Counties in northwestern Kansas, southwestern Red Willow, Hitchcock and Dundy Counties in southwestern Nebraska through 1100 PM MDT/MIDNIGHT CDT/... At 1014 PM MDT/1114 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles west of Stratton, or 12 miles northeast of Benkelman, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Stratton around 1125 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Trenton and Culbertson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM MDT/400 AM CDT/ for northwestern Kansas...and southwestern Nebraska.
